poem:
**News Quiz, No Prizes**

Fifteen questions and a torchlit hush,  
moustache of confidence, question mark of doubt.  
Bras snagged on HOLLYWOOD like lost flags.  
A broadcaster blushes—hacked, hijacked,  
its feed turned lurid.  

Traitors everywhere:  
formats migrating, loyalties changing hands.  

I tick boxes in pencil,  
and the week ticks back—  
no prizes, just the sound of it.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Thursday news quiz: torchbearers, traitors and troublemakers Thanks to Anaïs Mims’s whimsical illustrations, this week’s quiz invites you to consider an important question: are you the moustache of misplaced confidence, or the question mark of honest uncertainty? Fifteen questions on the week’s headlines, pop culture and general knowledge await. There are no prizes, but we enjoy hearing how you got on in the comments. Allons-y! The Thursday news quiz, No 232 The stars of the hit television series Heated Rivalry (not pictured) have been named official torchbearers for the Milan Cortina 2026 Winter Olympics. Who are they? Peter Claffey and Dexter Sol Ansell Diego Luna and Kyle Soller Hudson Williams and Connor Storrie Noel Gallagher and Damon Albarn Who has got into hot water after climbing up the Hollywood sign to hang bras (not pictured) on it? Margot Robbie Sydney Sweeney Florence Pugh Wile E Coyote Which movie has secured a record 16 Oscar nominations? One Battle After Another Sinners Bugonia Carry On Up the Khyber Which national broadcaster has a red face after its Facebook page was hacked and started posting pictures of the extreme pornography actor Bonnie Blue? ABC in Australia CBC in Canada NHK in Japan SBS in Syldavia You can't move for people talking about The Traitors. Where did the TV format originate? In Belgium as De Mol In Denmark as Forræder In the Netherlands as De Verraders In Germany as Dreißig-Fünfzig Wildschwein You can't move for people talking about Andy Burnham. Which byelection have the". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
